bibl.title: Letter from R.H. Brooke to Philip Showalter Hench, January 1, 1942

div1.p: Brooke informs Hench that the historical records pertaining to Reed were moved from Fort Myer to the National Archives.

div1.head: Letter from R.H. Brooke to Philip Showalter Hench, January 1, 1942
div1.opener:
IN REPLY REFER TO S. G. O. CCC 201 (Hench, P. S.)
rhb-gtr
WAR DEPARTMENT
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
WASHINGTON
January 1, 1942.
Dr. Philip S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester,
Minnesota.
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
In reply to your letter of December 30, 1941, regarding the
historical records pertaining to the late Dr. Walter Reed and his
colleagues in Havana, Cuba, in 1900 and 1901, I wish to state that
since my letter to you of June 11, 1941, all of these historical
records have been transferred from Fort Myer to the National Archives
for permanent storage. It will give me pleasure to accompany you to
the National Archives and introduce you to The Archivist. I am sure
the records will be available for your research work.

The office is simply swamped with defense work and it was found
necessary to move The Surgeon General's Office from the New Social
Security Building at 4th and C Streets, S.W., to Building No. 1818
H Street, N.W., this city, for the purpose of expansion.
I will be on the lookout for you on or about January 13, 1942.
Wishing you a very happy New Year, I remain
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, R. H. Brooke,
Chief Clerk. ALL COMMUNICATIONS SHOULD BE ADDRESSED TO “THE SURGEON GENERAL, U. S. ARMY, WASHINGTON, D. C.”
